task_summary: Perceive a pink cloth, approach and press to establish contact, then fold it by pushing along a line and settling before retreating.

task_long_description.overview: The PR2 arm manipulates a small pink cloth on a wooden tabletop. The goal is to fold the cloth by contacting near its midline and pushing in a straight direction to create a crease, then smoothing the fold briefly before withdrawing. The sequence emphasizes reliable perception, gentle contact, an orientation suitable for a straight-line fold, and a short stabilization pause before retreat. The gripper remains open, using the end-effector surface to press/slide rather than grasp.
preconditions: Workspace clear with cloth visible on table
Gripper operational and can remain open
Camera provides view for visibility checks
stepwise_plan: Detect the cloth and verify visibility; re-scan if not visible.
Open gripper and move above the cloth with a small clearance.
Lower until contact with low force threshold.
Align tool yaw for a straight fold direction.
Push along a line to fold one side over.
Optionally wipe along the seam to sharpen the fold.
Wait briefly to let fabric settle.
success_criteria: Cloth appears folded into a smaller rectangle
No excessive wrinkling or displacement off workspace
Robot ends in a safe, retracted pose
failure_and_recovery: If cloth not detected: raster scan then retry detection.
If contact not detected: repeat lower-with-contact step.
If fold slips or direction is off: repeat push with corrected yaw.
If fabric bunches: perform an extra wipe pass.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after the stabilization wait and a successful retreat to a safe distance.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Perceive the cloth on the table.
Quick check that the cloth is in view.
Raster search to reacquire the cloth if not visible.
Keep gripper open to use palm for pressing.
Pre-position above the cloth with small clearance.
Descend gently until contact is detected.
Align tool yaw for a vertical line push.
Push to fold the cloth over along a line.
Light wipe along the seam to sharpen the fold.
Back off to a safe pose.

failure_modes: Cloth not detected due to lighting or pose
Insufficient contact; fold does not occur
Over-push causing cloth to slide off area
recovery_strategy: Re-scan with raster pattern and re-detect
Repeat lower-until-contact with slightly larger depth
Reduce push distance and add wipe passes
Adjust yaw by ±45° and retry push
assumptions: Folding is achieved via push/press with open gripper (no grasp).
Push direction (90°) inferred from images; exact world frame not specified.
Wipe is used as a surrogate to crease/seal the fold since a dedicated fold action is not available.

expected_success_criteria: Final frames show a smaller, neatly folded rectangle in the workspace
Robot ends retracted with no further contact
